result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob A Kittleson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation becomes revoked, the jail sentence may be served with huber.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.

miscConds.notes:
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

records.addlTxt: Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year (07/06/2018)

1:02 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Melina Thao present in court via telephone.  Court questions defendant.  Statement by defendant - concurs, has not paid anything.  Statement by Agent Thao - has not paid anything.  Statement by defendant.  Statement by Agent Thao.  Court finds the defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for a period of 1 year.  Court instrucst defendant that if monies are not paid by the time probation is due to discharge, court will fashion conditions to include jail time.  Court instructs defendant regarding right to counsel.

Court adjourned at 1:08 p.m.
Probation review hearing on June 19, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob A Kittleson

Prior: 3754 Glenhurst Ln, Oshkosh, WI 54904

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
11:19 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to an amended charge of Disorderly Conduct.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 as amended and strikes the enhancer.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

90 days county jail, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 1 year.  Huber if revoked.  Court grant out of county travel and out of county service.

CONDITIONS:

-Court costs.
-AODA assessment and any follow-up.
-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent including any counseling and/or treatment as recommended.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Court adjourned at 11:26 a.m.

Warrant cancelled - never sent down to GLSO.
43

Court adjourned at 3:14 p.m.
Status hearing on May 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Warrant never sent down to GLSO - held til defendant's appearance on 05/17/2016.

9:10 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.  Court will set for Status Hearing on October 20, 2015 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:11 a.m.
